bill_title: prohibit unsolicited gaming e-mail and to provide a penalty therefor.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to prohibit unsolicited gaming e-mail and to provide a penalty therefor. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 22-25 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: No person may send or cause to be sent to any South Dakota e-mail address any commercial e-mail message soliciting the addressee to engage in internet gaming or advertising the availability of internet gaming unless the addressee has specifically requested such e-mail. A violation of this Act is a petty offense and subjects the violator to a fine not to exceed three hundred fifty dollars for each message sent and received in violation of this section. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
